title: Projects - Robbie Ferrand
text:
Robbie Michael Ferrand

  

  📊Statistician/Data Scientist

  📍 Raleigh, North Carolina

  🎓 M.R in Statistics

  🏫 North Carolina State University

  

    ✉ Email

    🔗 LinkedIn

  












Projects

Metal Concentration in Turtles is an R-based project concerning the investigation of urbanization on freshwater turtles. My partner and I were offered (and accepted) co-authorship on the client’s paper due to our statistical contributions.
Keywords: high-dimensional statistical modeling, lasso regression, Redundancy Analysis (RDA), Best subsets regression, rank analysis, exploratory data analysis, turtles, proxy, urbanization, metals

Are Students Using the Right Criteria When Choosing Schools? is a paper completed for ST704, Statistical Methods II. This paper uses multiple advanced statistical techniques to analyze complex data, such as Beta Regression, Quantile Regression, and Spatial Regression.
Keywords: Beta regression, spatial modeling, spatial covariate, quantile regression, crime rate, university matriculation, college, pinball loss function, student, United States

  

Preview of Crime/Matriculation Project



Mobile Data Exploratory Analysis is an RShiny-based project that creates an interactive dashboard app for users to numerically and graphically explore a Mobile Behavior data set. App was created to fulfill project requirements for ST558, Data Science for Statisticians. The App has been ported from The ShinyApps Website.

Keywords: Exploratory data analysis, ggplot, rshiny, mobile behavior, client-centered, interactive, download, subsetting, categorical analysis, numerical analysis, facet wrap


  

Preview of Mobile Data Analysis Project

title: Hobbies and Interests - Robbie Ferrand
text:
Robbie Michael Ferrand

  

  📊Statistician/Data Scientist

  🎓 M.R in Statistics

  🏫 North Carolina State University

  

    ✉ Email

    🔗 LinkedIn

  












Hobbies and Interests

🎾 I’m an avid Tennis enjoyer. I play at the 3.5/4.0 NTRP level and consider myself an aggressive baseliner.
🏃 I am a (newbie!) long-distance runner. Hoping to run some more half-marathons in 2025 and run a full marathon in 2026. I love to run in forested, shrubby environments where nature is aplenty!
☀️️ I’m from Florida, specifically the Tampa/Orlando areas. Although the beach has my heart forever, I enjoy the moderate climate in the Carolinas and plan to reside here permanently. :)
🗣️ I love public speaking - teaching was a lot of fun because it gave me an avenue to explore speaking to a large group regularly. I generally prefer a larger audience when presenting my research because it gets me in the zone.
🎮 When not doing work, playing tennis, or running, I have a soft spot for video games and board games. I enjoy the collaborative kind and the fast-paced competitive kind.

title: Education - Robbie Ferrand
text:
Robbie Michael Ferrand

  

  📊Statistician/Data Scientist

  📍 Raleigh, North Carolina

  🎓 M.R in Statistics

  🏫 North Carolina State University

  

    ✉ Email

    🔗 LinkedIn

  












Education







North Carolina State University


August 2023 - December 2024


Master of Science in Statistics (MR)


PhD Core Coursework


GPA: 3.733/4.0


University Graduate Fellowship



Relevant Coursework





ST701 - (PhD) Statistical Theory I: Properties of random variables, transformations of random variables, expected values, moment generating functions, multivariate distributions, marginal and conditional distributions, convergence


ST702 - (PhD) Statistical Theory II: General framework for statistical inference, biased and unbiased estimators, minimum variance estimators, least mean square error, maximum likelihood, asymptotic properties, likelihood ratio tests, efficiency, sufficiency


ST703 - (PhD) Statistical Methods I: Multiple linear regression, ANOVA, experimental design, factorial experiments, random effects modeling, introduction to SAS, F-tests, nested F-tests, analysis of model metrics


ST704 - (PhD) Statistical Methods II: model generation, model selection and assessment, diagnostics of multiple and penalized regression, linear mixed models, GLM, GLMM, nonparametric regression, smoothing and splines, finite-population sampling basics


ST705 - (PhD) Linear Models and Variance Components: Theory of estimation and testing in full and non-full rank linear models, normal theory distribution properties, Gauss-Markov theorem, estimability and properties of best linear unbiased estimators, dummy variable methods, variance components estimation for balanced data, matrix representation of hypothesis testing


ST531 - Experimental Design: Types of experimental designs and their functions, ANOVA, completely randomized designs, completely randomized block design, balanced block design, incomplete block designs, latin square designs, mixed effects models, confounded factorials, split plot designs, fractional factorial designs


ST542 - Statistical Consulting: Offers a discussion-based introduction geared towards statistical practice, provide a client-centered product, communicate professionally, write structured research papers, understand statistical ethics


ST555 - SAS Programming I: Industry standard for statistical practice, data vectors, import/validate/export data files, manipulate/subset/group data, merge and append data, summary reporting and code debugging


ST558 - Data Science for Statisticians: Methods for reading, manipulating, and combining data sources including databases in R, Custom functions, visualizations, summaries and creating visual dashboards.


ST563 - Statistical Learning: Supervised and unsupervised statistical learning techniques, regression, classification, clustering, dimension reduction, regularized regression, bootstrap, cross-validation, discriminant analysis, random forests, bagging, boosting














University of Central Florida


August 2018 - December 2021


Bachelor of Science in Statistics (BS)


College of Sciences Valedictorian


GPA: 4.0/4.0


Duke Energy Undergraduate Research Fellowship

title: Welcome! - Robbie Ferrand
text:
Robbie Michael Ferrand

  

  📊Statistician/Data Scientist

  📍 Raleigh, North Carolina

  🎓 M.R in Statistics

  🏫 North Carolina State University

  

    ✉ Email

    🔗 LinkedIn

  












Welcome!


  


Introduction


Hi! I’m Robbie, a data professional with a Master’s in Statistics from NC State University, where I completed PhD core coursework in statistical methods and theory. With almost 5 years of relevant experience in data science, research, and statistician-based work, I specialize in delivering insights that empower data-driven strategies. I am proficient in R, SAS, JMP, CSS/HTML, Python, and more. This website is intended to present snippets of my work, as well as more information about who I am.


The quick links below can direct you to any page of interest on my website. :)


Quick Links


Projects Work Experience Education Resume Interests Contact Me

title: Crime Rate and Matriculation Rate - Robbie Ferrand
text:
Crime Rate and Matriculation Rate


Project Abstract:


Given the evidence that crime rates affect the learning ability of middle and high school students, this analysis focuses on trying to determine whether students across the US are using crime rates when picking a university or college to attend. Using a university’s matriculation rate as a response and crime rates as covariates, we fit a beta regression, first without and then accounting for spatial autocorrelation. Given the evidence that the impact of crime rates may vary for universities with different matriculation rates, we lastly fit a quantile regression to show that only a small range of universities are marginally affected by the area’s crime rate. This trend speaks to the apparent lack of student care in crime rates in the university’s town or city, and given the importance of local crime in learning, students should be made more aware of the importance of crime rates in the colleges they plan on attending.

Click Here to View the Full Paper
